page.title: 04Fly Fishing Facilties
page.content: Whitwell Lodge is situated on a peninsular of land jutting out into Rutland Water,providing facilities for fly fishermen. Over 50,000 anglers fish here during the season either from the bank or a boat. Wardens are on duty to give advice on tactics and run courses for beginners. Permits are available and rules must be adhered to. Club events and international and national events are run here, and the lodge contains a tackle shop and lounge where refreshments can be served. There is also a room for fish-gutting with a freezer for those who come to spend some days fishing before returning home. Most seasons produce over 60,000 trout with an average weight of 2lbs. The largest trout caught weighed over 12lbs.
